column4: any reason a disk would show as full when it's not ?  It seems like there is a difference between how I setup my / and /media partitions and the way they are being used...
- df -hi will tell if you you are out of inodes....
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inode
where and how can I post you my df -h ?
- just opened a private dialog with you mate post there
I don't see it... sorry
here's my pastebin:  http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/60458/
why have you got /var/lock and /var/un seperate?
can you past your error too please
I don't have the error, but Disk Usage Analyzer 'sees' my partitions as smaller than they are...
so they show as 100% full, but in the summary line it says I'm only using 65Gb with 226Gb free...
- well that's odd because df is authoratiative on what is being used and now...
I have NO CLUE about /var/lock and /var/un, I didn't set this up, don't know what went wrong or when

I wonder whether since nothing else can now write to /var/run and /var/lock the app is have issues. *ponders* How are your disks partiioned - paste /etc/fstab and /etc/mtab please mate... anyone else btw?
how do I get my /etc/fstab to paste it ?
here's my fstab http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/60462/
and now my /etc/mtab: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/60463/
you can also cat /etc/mtab to see what is mounted at the moment
may I pm you ?
- yes
- or create a chan with your username and I will join
